subject: RE: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

cc.name: Gaby Mahoney;Zach Bondi;Colby Durden;Andrew Albright;Matthew Yang

body:
I don�t have a list that is easy to share but if you give me locations, I can take a look. If one of our traffic signals is close that would be the easiest.

 

Bret Jones

Traffic Operations

City of Eugene

O:541-682-4908

C:541-228-5722

 

From: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov> 
Sent: Wednesday, June 11, 2025 7:54 AM
To: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com>; JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov>
Cc: Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com>; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com>; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com>; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com>; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com>
Subject: RE: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

 

Good morning,

 

I would like to see how we can work through this with the least amount of work put onto Bret as he has a full time job that�s not with the PD and has been gracious enough to help us with this project.  If he can provide either a map or a list of what is city traffic poles or what isn�t in the city, we can work together on moving the cameras.  My suspicion is that most of the cameras on Flock poles are near intersections that are city owned and we can adjust them accordingly.  When looking at the map, its hard for me to decipher what is on a Flock pole verse an existing pole without clicking on each one.  If we could start by sending a list with each location that will need to be evaluated, I can start working on locating suitable replacement locations and then we can verify with Bret that those locations are indeed city owned.

 

Let me know what you think,


Derek

 

Detective D. DeWitt

Financial Crimes Unit

Special Weapons and Tactics Team

Background Investigations Team

Eugene Police Department

300 County Club Road

Eugene, OR 97401

Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.

Desk Phone � 541-682-2682

Work Cell � 541-743-6192

 



 

From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
Sent: Wednesday, June 11, 2025 6:13 AM
To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >; JONES Bret <BJones@eugene-or.gov BJones@eugene-or.gov >
Cc: Gaby Mahoney <gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com gaby.mahoney@flocksafety.com >; Zach Bondi <zach.bondi@flocksafety.com zach.bondi@flocksafety.com >; Colby Durden <colby.durden@flocksafety.com colby.durden@flocksafety.com >; Andrew Albright <andrew.albright@flocksafety.com andrew.albright@flocksafety.com >; Matthew Yang <matt.yang@flocksafety.com matt.yang@flocksafety.com >
Subject: Flock Poles to Existing Poles

 

[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi Detective,

 

Starting a separate email chain to discuss the Flock pole vandalism. Below are the numbers for the Flock poles as of today. The installed number is inclusive of the ones that have been pushed down.

 

Flock poles installed - 17

Flock poles not yet installed - 5




We all agree that we need to proceed with relocating these to existing poles. Best way would probably be to get on a call with Brett to go over city managed traffic light locations. If he cannot get on a call, I can send him location info for each of the Flock poles and then he can let us know the nearest traffic light that works. From there we can make the switch on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c58235beb45cca096a11d91f4f54a8de201176a35dc694b577a2e4d159d2a58e3f0f3961f45e01640c902f1b3f39dc543ad2  and then get back to moving on these.

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Regards

	
 

Matt Triana
Project Manager



	
 https://www.foxbusiness.com/technology/safety-tech-company-launches-tool-help-law-enforcement-fight-human-trafficking?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=PMO&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/oqJleE79JwmM.png>
